case_vignette: A 50-year-old farmer presents to a physician with painless, black, severely swollen pustules on the left hand. Examination reveals extensive swelling around the wound. Microscopy reveals gram-positive bacilli with a bamboo stick appearance. Culture shows large, gray, non-hemolytic colonies with irregular borders.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got these painless, black, really swollen spots on my left hand.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, chills, or fatigue?
No, I haven't noticed any fever, chills, or fatigue.
Have you had any recent injuries or cuts on your hand?
Yes, I had some cuts on my hand recently.
Have you been in contact with anyone who has recently been diagnosed with a skin infection?
No, I haven't been in contact with anyone who has a skin infection.
Have you been in any areas with poor hygiene or contaminated water sources?
As a farmer, I am often around places that might not be very clean or could have contaminated water.
Have you been taking any medications recently?
No, I haven't been taking any medications.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin color or texture?
Yes, the spots on my hand are black and the area around them is severely swollen.
Final Diagnosis: Melanoma.
